channel.title: Woot! - One Day, One Deal
channel.itunes:summary: The midnightly sonic alert about what's on sale at Woot.com, with exclusive novelty songs and other gags in the jaundiced Woot style. Come for the deals, stay for the laffs!

item.title: WWWoundup: Search Log Poetry
item.description:
One minute you're minding your own business, searching AOL for help with your "numb fingers" and your "dog that urinates on everything" - the next, your intimate search secrets are plastered all over the New York Times. The bumbling clowns at AOL may have hastily acted to hide those 20 million web search queries they released last weekend, but it was too late: now you can search the whole list yourself. I always want to get to know you guys better, so I decided to find everybody who's searched for "woot" and see what else they'd been looking for. Struck by the peculiar intimacy of a few users' logs, I decided to cobble some of these phrases together into instant poems. We're keeping the ID numbers of these AOL users to ourselves, to maintain at least a veneer of privacy, but every one of the following  accidental authors searched for "woot" at least once.

Our first inadvertent search-log poet answers the poignant title question with a rapid-fire series of vivid images, exploring the manifold meanings of the human body:

how many steps in a mile

make me beautiful
do people really carve designs in the palm of their hands
instead of bradford pear you should plant
mr. missouri contest
head lice treatment
baby sitter is male
itching palm money or company
pictures of american revolution heroes
sharp stabbing stomach pains
poo poo poo
free sample kosher
fema trailers for sale
free software for keeping track of employee attendance vacation
does david caruso always tilt his head

Powerful, no? Next up, a whimsical satire of consumerism, the medical establishment, and cabbage, from a poet to be named never:


flea medication revolution

double chin liposuction
inside a tire metal ring to be covered with rubber
how to stencil on outdoor carpet
crock pot corned beef and cabbage
shoulder passive range of motion tender to
ketchup substitute
where is fuel filter in 2002 pontiac grand am
how to color tint ceramic tile
sciatic nerve lesion tests
grammar hyphens the boy was pain free

Well said, anonymous AOL bard. Finally, here's a feminist meditation on death, starring an unlikely pair of cultural icons:

decorating an office

is femhrt made from horse urine
calories burned while weight lifting
when your mother dies
what can cause pain on the left side of your waist
why is it so stormy now
teri hatcher
larry bird as a teenager
indiana department of correction
is the catholic church a cult
what does the word woot mean

Whew! I don't know about you, but I'm weeping bitter tears for the fate of the human condition. Anyway, although we could go on all day with this stuff, here's a better idea: why don't you dive into the AOL search log and compose your own accidental masterpieces? We limited ourselves to users who searched for "woot", but you don't have to. Post the good ones below...

Four O' Clock Flash: I got so swept up in the ecstatic rush of language, I almost forgot about Cow Tipping. Wait until the cows sleep before you push them over - learned that the hard way with a score of -52 (that's negative 52) on my first try.

item.title: AudioFX Force Feedback Gaming Headset - $19.99
item.description:
War is no place for the timid. And virtual war is no place for your sleeping roommate, uptight parents, or nitpicky neighbors. How does the concerned gamer of today reconcile the demands of a pluralistic society with a craving to have his (or her) (OK, probably his) eardrums liquefied by the explosions of battle and the moans of the vanquished? Look deeply into the the AudioFX Force Feedback Gaming Headset, my child, and there you will find the answers you seek.

In case you care, they get rapturous reviews for sound quality – consult the Internet for details. This is the only headset officially certified by the voice-chat kommissars at Teamspeak. And they’re as solidly built as your level 10 Warforged barbarian. If you can find a better gaming headset at this price, buy 10,000 units for us. We’re good for it.

But beyond mere quality, the AudioFX Force Feedback Gaming Headset has gimmicks coming out its black-and-silver wazoo. They vibrate, which we’re sure isn’t incredibly annoying if you’re into that kind of thing! They have LED sound meters on the outside of each ear cup, so you can show that stuck-up jerk at the LAN party who the real loser is! These flashy follies may seem a trifle unnecessary, but AudioFX understands: you don’t sell the steak, you sell the sizzle.

Damage your eardrums without damaging your social standing. The AudioFX Force Feedback Gaming Headset makes it possible to maintain both the gaming noise to which you’ve become accustomed and cordial relationships with other human beings. (Assuming, of course, you have such relationships to begin with.)

Warranty: 90 days

Specifications:

  • High quality, full ear headset with microphone
  • Unique force feedback effect creates a more enjoyable and realistic audio environment
  • Feel the energy of your favorite games, movies and music with real pulsing vibrations
  • Certified for use with voice recognition software and pc gaming or standard audio equipment
  • Premium ear cushioning for long hours of listening comfort
  • LED sound meters on each side
  • Driver Unit: 057mm, Cobalt Magnet
  • Driver Impedance: 32 Ohm +/-10%
  • Driver Sensitivity: 106dB +/-3dB at 1KHz
  • Driver Frequency Response: 20-20,000Hz
  • Driver Maximum Power Handling: 100t mW
  • Microphone Type: 10mm Electrets Condenser
  • Microphone Directivity: Noise Canceling
  • Microphone Sensitivity: – 58dB +/– 3dB
  • Microphone Frequency Response: 30-16,000Hz
  • Microphone Standard Operating Voltage: 5V
  • System Requirements: Any PC with integrated or third-party sound card and 1 available USB port for power

Discuss this product

Price: $19.99
item.media:title: AudioFX Force Feedback Gaming Headset
item.itunes:author: Woot

item.title: WWWoundup: Wednesday Wandomness
item.description:
There's no unifying conceit, no overarching motif, no cute little thematic ribbon to wrap around today's WWWoundup - just a mess of innaresting links for your clicking pleasure. If you've ever wondered how the peoples of the world eliminate their bodily wastes, check out this extensive survey of different kinds of toilets, from the concrete bench-commodes of ancient Rome to the hi-tech bidets of modern Europe. Often, when I "make water," it's because I've had too much soda to drink, so I was interested in this review of the new Pepsi Jazz. I think I might give it a try; Dave Bug said he was tempted to, but he got the impression it was marketed toward women and wondered if it might disturb his hormonal balance. If any typeface deserves to be immortalized in film, it's Helvetica, star of an upcoming biopic. Actually, I'm partial to Gill Sans myself, but you won't catch me knocking the Helv. The geniuses who set up this massive indoor marijuana farm figured out everything except how not to get caught. And if you're wondering where I found the cheerfully suicidal French pig to the left, it's from this collection of weird vintage ads from around the world.

Four O' Clock Flash: Oh, man...tell the receptionist to hold all your calls and cancel all your meetings, because Dice Wars will pwn your afternoon. It's kinda like an abstracted verson of Risk, but that doesn't really capture its insidious addictiveness. You've been warned.

item.title: Invicta Men’s Stainless Steel Pro Diver Multifunction Watch
item.description:
What she says: Hi, I couldn’t help noticing your Invicta Men’s Stainless Steel Pro Diver Multifunction Watch. I bet you’re one of those adventurous types.
What she means: Your rugged yet refined choice of watch tells me you might be good at providing for my offspring and defending them from wolves, enemy tribes, and schoolyard bullies.

What he says: Oh, this old thing? Why, yes, its surgical-grade stainless steel construction and 100-meter water resistance do come in handy when I go mountain climbing, whitewater rafting, or hiking through the Kalahari. With its Swiss quartz movement, I always know I’ll be on time for my next client meeting or yoga class. And when I cross the International Date Line on one of my frequent overseas business trips, I only have to reset the day and date calendar once to stay on schedule.
What he means: Sometimes I drink so much Woot wine that I drop my watch in the toilet, or forget what day it is and miss my shift behind the register at GameStop.

What she says: I see. And what about the blue face? Pretty bold choice.
What she means: A blue watch with an orange shirt? Either you're color-blind or you play for the New York Mets.

What he says: I’m a bold guy.
What he means: It was the only color for sale on Woot.

What she says: Very interesting. I guess this must be my lucky day. I don’t meet many guys like you, you know.
What she means: Well, you don’t smell quite as bad as most of the other creeps in here. And you’re not wearing a baseball cap with a beer-company or farm-implement logo on it. You’ll do, for now.

What he says: There aren’t many guys like me. Maybe we could continue this conversation back at your place.
What he means: I can’t afford any more drinks, and my mom always wakes up when I try to sneak women into the house.

What she says: Sounds great. Mind if I ride with you?
What she means: I have to make sure you drive something decent before I go through with this.

What he says: My lady, your chariot awaits.
What he means: I hope she does’t live too far from the bus line.

Warranty: One year Invicta

Features:

  • Blue dial
  • Swiss-quartz movement
  • Day-and-date calendar
  • Water resistant to 330 feet
  • Tritnite luminous hands and dotted dial markers
  • Stainless steel bezel, case and band
  • Sapphire crystal
  • Deployment buckle clasp
  • Unidirectional rotating bezel
  • Screw-down back case
  • Case diameter: 42.0 millimeters
  • Case Thickness: 12.0 millimeters
  • Band length: mens-standard
  • Band width: 20.0 millimeters

Discuss this product
item.media:title: Invicta Men’s Stainless Steel Pro Diver Multifunction Watch
item.itunes:author: Woot

item.title: WWWoundup: YouTubesday
item.description:
Ah, those crazy college kids. They've moved on from pole-sitting and bombing ROTC offices to breaking out in song during lectures, or arranging a cappella versions of video game music, or staging live-action theatrical versions of those games. Elsewhere in the tube-o-sphere, a guy has a really, really bad cough, and another guy gets scolded for his japery during a local news segment. If you get tired of such cerebral doings and decide you'd rather just zone out with some visual stimulation, check out this gorgeous strobe light experiment or this eyeball-tweaking, LSD-simulating optical illusion.

Four O' Clock Flash: As promised, here's your daily Flash game time-waster, to carry you through that last hour of the day. If you've ever wanted to be a Venus flytrap, Feed Me is your chance. And you don't have to worry about those wings getting stuck between your teeth.

item.title: Saitek Cyborg Graphite USB Joystick - 2 Pack
item.description:
Like a scalded, skeletal battlebot staggering out of the nuclear flames to stalk a shattered post-apocalyptic futurescape, the Saitek Cyborg Graphite Joystick refuses to be exterminated. No matter how many times we peddle it, no matter how much we slash the price, it rises anew to demand your attention and ours. We’re starting to think its most impressive quality is its sheer tenacity.

But then we remember its three separate handle adjustments and its easy USB hookup. We’re reminded of its panoply of fire buttons, its 8-way hat switch, its smooth level throttle. The Saitek Cyborg Graphite Joystick’s got a lot more going for it than bottomless quantities at bottomful prices. But yeah, we’re way sick of looking at the ungainly things, let alone trying to write pithy, clever little essays about their virtues. So we’re counting on you to pick them off, two at a time. With your courage, perseverance, and credit card, our home page will be forever free of the Saitek Cyborg Graphite Joystick scourge. What’ll it be? Can we count on you, fellow human?

Warranty: 90 days

Features:

  • Super smooth level throttle
  • Three axis control ( X, Y, Throttle)
  • 8-way hat switch
  • Adjustable thumb length
  • Left or right handed throttle
  • Adjustable thumb angle
  • Adjustable hand size
  • 4 fire buttons
  • Adjustment tool included
  • Plug’n’Play USB design
  • Compatible with Windows 98, ME, 2000 and XP


Discuss this product
item.media:title: Saitek Cyborg Graphite USB Joystick - 2 Pack
item.itunes:author: Woot

item.title: Winners' Gallery: the Best of Contest 84
item.description:
Return with us now to the thrilling days of yesterweek, when Talladega Nights ruled the box office, war raged in Lebanon, and the MIMO craze was taking hold of a MIMO-hungry nation. Now that MIMO fever has faded, our challenge to Take any product Woot has ever sold and add a feature or features that can be accurately labeled with the acronym MIMO seems like a quaint relic of a gentler, simpler, more MIMOcent time. Let's walk down MIMOry lane with these molden oldies:

First Prize - $100
KMA2 - Maximum Impact Memory Overlay
Now that's research! Hell, even we forgot that we once sold a guitar. We also approve of the visual reference to The Only Band That Matters.



Second Prize - $50
digitalecho - Mint Infused Manual Operations
Because nobody wants "gamer whiff" in their rec room, kitchenette, or solarium.



Third Prize - $20
ReverendPete - Many Intoxicating Machine Outputs
6:30 AM, everybody! Time for one of the good Rev's homebrew wake-me-ups!


Honorable Mention

taipan - Multiple Irregular Male Orb
We have no idea what this one could possibly be about.



plinth - Mechanically Inserted Mustache Option
Is it weird that we find Natalie a little more attractive with that 'stache?



kupdaddy - Mariachis In Maternity Outerwear
Ah, the pitter-patter of tiny little guitarróns .



jaycous - More Illegal Media Options
People don't really use these to listen to illegally pirated materials, do they?



Pixel8 - Manly Integrated Mouse Options
It don't mean a thing if it ain't got that wire stripper.



Omegagames - Metabolic Invasive Micro-Organisms
We can never get past the megaboss on level 43.



mnementh - Mushroom-Induced Mental Odyssey
Man, giving away our trade secrets like, totally bums out our trip.



Champions' Championship Champion
zjr - Mysterious Indecent Malicious Odor
People can't get enough of the baggacrap, henh?


And this week's Monkey Prize goes to the possibly misspelled guiseppi and his chuckle-inducing wig-out entitled Mullet Increases Moisture Observation :


Well OK then. Them what created the money-winning entries are invited to email their Paypal info to jtoon@woot.com. The Monkey winner should send his/her mailing address to the same, and Honorable Mentioneers may use coupon code HONMEN-FS for free shipping on a future order. Until next time, money is my opium.

item.title: WWWoundup: The Internet Knows Better
item.description: Thank God (or Gore?) for the Internet. Before it came along, I would have to ask an actual human being questions like "Should I quit my job?" or "How come no girls like me even though I'm always doing whatever they want me to do (except leave them alone)?" Not anymore! For one thing, I managed to hoodwink a perfectly swell girl into marrying me (Hi, sucker! I mean, honey!). For another, now I simply consult the great electronic hive-mind from the solitary safety of my bunker, and follow its dictates unto death. Right now, you might be wondering "How can creative lighting help the resale value of my house?" or "How can I accomodate vegetarian guests?" No need for any scary, nerve-wracking, possibly unhygienic human contact - from my most public internet auctions to my most intimate moments of sleep, the Internet is the boss of me. What online wisdom have you been living by lately?

item.title: iRobot Scooba Floor Washing Robot
item.description:
I, Eugene Sneezlebaum, being of relatively sound mind, do hereby make the following amendments to the standing list of tasks I refuse to perform on the grounds that there are robots to do them for me.

I am pleased that recent advances in commercially viable robotics technology allow me to abstain from these often repetitive or dangerous activities in favor of higher pursuits.

Effective immediately, my friends, relatives, employers and acquaintances should no longer expect me to:

13. EXPLORE SPACE
Do not expect me to explore outer space. A robot is better suited to this task than I, who would run out of material for all my favorite road trip time-killing games shortly after escaping Earth’s atmosphere. Imagine it: “Houston, I spy with my little eye something vast, black and cold as death.”

“Is it the empty void of space?”

“You win again, Houston.” Booorrinnng.

Also, as I indicated in list item no. 7 (EXPLORE UNDERSEA CANYONS), robots do not breathe air, and I totally do. I refuse to go anyplace where the oxygen is BYO.

14. PERFORM RESISTANCE SPOT WELDING FOR AUTO BODY ASSEMBLY
I don’t know exactly what this is, but it sounds laborious, and I understand there are robots specialists for it, so I’m putting it on the list just to be safe.

15. TRANSLATE FROM HUTTESE TO BASIC
Certain protocol droids are fluent in over six million forms of communication. They’re hard to come by, as most were manufactured a long time ago and superlatively far away. That they exist, however, means that I shall not be wasting any more time in Spanish class.

16. CLEAN TILE, LINOLEUM, MARBLE AND SEALED HARDWOOD FLOORS
iRobot’s Scooba uses a four-stage cleaning process to prep, wash, scrub, and dry floors all by itself. Its dozens of sensors keep it on track and cleaning effectively, intelligently and safely. It’s as quick, clean and efficient as German lovemaking.

It has four cleaning steps, which it performs sequentially in just one pass over my (frankly sickeningly filthy) floor. First: it picks up dirt and debris; second: it sprays a sweet-smelling cleaning solution; third: it scrubs with a spinning brush; and fourth, it vacuums and squeegees up all the moisture and dirt into a separate tank, leaving hard floors squeaky clean and as dry as a Methodist potluck!

The marvelous little Scooba will prep, wash, scrub and dry almost any kind of hard floors. OK, it’s not suited for unsealed wood floors or laminate wood flooring like “Pergo®,” but what care I of such minor limitations? Scooba will deliver me forever from the drudgery of scrubbing my kitchen on my hands and knees, and it’ll do the job faster than I ever could—one 45-minute cycle is sufficient to clean a standard-sized kitchen in its entirety!

Being cordless, Scooba runs on a built-in rechargeable battery, which, fully charged, yields 80 minutes of cleaning power. The included Virtual Wall—which helps keeps Scooba contained where you want it cleaning—runs on a pair of D batteries (sold, as they say, separately). I’ve ordered mine; it’s in the mail. I’ve scrubbed my last tile by hand.

17. DANCE “THE ROBOT”
I’ve always been better at “the worm” anyway—and, in my experience, it’s more of a crowd-pleaser.

For further information, or for a copy of the complete list comprising all previous entries plus the above additions, please contact me at home, where I will be relaxing in my Iron Lung.

Sincerely,
Eugene K. Sneezlebaum

Warranty: One year

Features:

  • Floor-washing robot that preps, washes, scrubs, and dries in one pass
  • Cleans under furniture, tables, and hard-to-reach places
  • Safe to use on most hard floors, including sealed hardwood, linoleum, tile, and marble
  • Simple to operate—fill tank, press “Clean,” and empty tank when finished
  • Includes one 8-oz. bottle of cleaning solution

Whats in the Box:

  • iRobot Scooba floor-washing robot
  • Battery
  • Power supply
  • 1 virtual wall (requires 2 D batteries, not included)
  • 8-oz. bottle Clorox Scooba cleaning solution
  • Measuring cup

Discuss this product
item.media:title: iRobot Scooba Floor Washing Robot
item.itunes:author: Woot

item.title: Hamilton Beach 4 Quart Capacity Ice Cream Maker
item.description:
Take a hike, Baskin! Get lost, Robbins! Go fly a tie-dyed kite, Ben! Put that in your water pipe and smoke it, Jerry! You’re dead to us now. You’re redundant, unnecessary, irrelevant, outmoded. The Hamilton Beach 4 Quart Capacity Ice Cream Maker is the killer app(liance) that will forever ruin your palate for major-label ice cream.

No, from now on we’ll be swinging to the sweet sounds of our own home-crafted, hand-tooled iced creams, yogurts, custards, sherbets, and gelati, four delicious quarts at a time. It’s fully automatic, eliminating the old ice-cream injury known as “cranker’s elbow.” It includes over 20 recipes, since nobody’s born knowing how to make delicious ice cream. And the lid is of the Easy-Lock variety, because ice cream tastes better in your mouth than all over your kitchen counter.

Now that we’ve got the Hamilton Beach 4 Quart Capacity Ice Cream Maker, we’ll never touch a spoonful of anybody’s ice cream but our own. Hey, we don’t know where that other stuff’s been. And we certainly don’t trust some overworked, underpaid FDA-crat to make sure it’s free of animal droppings, medical waste, or seeds and stems.

Warranty: One year

Features:

  • 4 Quart capacity
  • Makes ice cream, frozen yogurt, custard, sherbet & gelato
  • Who doesn't like ice cream?
  • Seriously, it's un-American to not like ice cream
  • Fully automatic
  • Plastic outer bucket
  • Metal ice cream canister
  • Easy Lock lid
  • Over 20 recipes included

Discuss this product
item.media:title: Hamilton Beach 4 Quart Capacity Ice Cream Maker
